kakamas.name: Kakamas Peach
kakamas.desc: Firm yellow skin, classic canning variety.
kakamas.full: Kakamas is a popular South African canning peach. It has a yellow skin and very firm yellow flesh, making it ideal for processing and long storage. Known for reliability and consistency.

earligrande.name: Earligrande
earligrande.desc: Early oval peach with bright red blush.
earligrande.full: Earligrande is an early-season peach with an oval shape and pointed end. It features yellow skin with up to 75% red coverage and a pleasant flavour with a coarse texture.

transvalia.name: Transvalia
transvalia.full: Transvalia peaches have a bold red blush over a yellow background. The flesh ranges from yellow to orange and offers a good taste with a fine texture.

bonnigold.name: Bonnigold
bonnigold.desc: Round yellow peach with non-melting flesh.
bonnigold.full: Bonnigold peaches are round with yellow skin and flesh. They are known for their non-melting texture and fair taste, mainly used in processing and canning.

summersun.name: Summersun
summersun.desc: Light yellow peach with no red blush.
summersun.full: Summersun peaches have a light yellow skin with no red colouring. The flesh is also light yellow and offers a smooth, gentle sweetness.

excellence.name: Excellence
excellence.desc: Yellow skin with deep red blush.
excellence.full: Excellence peaches show a strong red blush on golden skin. The yellow flesh is sweet and juicy with good eating quality.

keisie.name: Keisie
keisie.desc: Firm yellow peach ideal for canning.
keisie.full: Keisie peaches have yellow skin and firm yellow flesh. They are well suited for canning operations due to their strong structure and consistent shape.
